requirements:

We want the people who are brave enough to work at the cutting edge and create solutions that will enrich and improve the lives of people across the globe. So, if you want to make the world say wow, let's talk.

We are looking for an aspiring developer with a background in developing web or android applications and server APIs.

The ideal candidate enjoys development as their side hobby, exploring new web frameworks and languages, and is fastidious about their code. Using and/or contributing to open-source projects is big plus as well as experience with unit testing code, continuous integration and test-driven development.

This position is based at Sony Electronics U.S. Headquarters, located in San Diego, CA.

NodeJS, MySQL, PHP, Java, Angular, Backbone, Underscore

title: 2021 Software Engineer, Intern
requirements:
Zoomies help the world connect — and deliver happiness while doing it. We set out to build the best video conferencing product for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Phone, Zoom Rooms, Zoom Video Webinars, Zoom Apps, and OnZoom.

We’re problem-solvers and self-starters, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Here, you’ll work across teams to dig deep into impactful projects that are changing the way people communicate, and enjoy opportunities to advance your career in a diverse, inclusive environment.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will have opportunities to work across our stack, developing software ranging from Web Server to business application layer for our distributed, cloud-hosted backend. This paid internship is for a duration of approximately 10 - 12 weeks during the Summer of 2021. The program offers cutting edge projects, as well as a mix of additional types of learning in areas of leadership and business acumen -- and is packed full of fun! Our goal is to provide our interns with world-class managed experiences, so we can ensure happiness occurs every step of the way!

Responsibilities
Assist with building and maintaining Zoom product features and services.
Build, deploy and upgrade our real-time compute infrastructure.
Design and implement features to improve our systems.
Connect with customers to understand their goals and needs and translate those into solutions our team can deliver.
Configure tooling for systems scalability, ensure we have the capacity for future growth.
Ensure our systems are continuously monitored and running efficiently with a consistent, unified experience across products, platforms, and devices.
Test current algorithms and write testing documents.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders across the business to drive the delivery of features, processes, and happiness.

Requirements
At least 18 years old, currently enrolled in a four-year academic institution completing an undergrad, grad, or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, Information Technology, or a related STEM field.
Legally authorized to work in the United States. Due to the limited duration of this program, sponsorship for employment visa status is not available for this position.
Availability to complete the full 10-12-week internship program during Summer 2021, with a time commitment of approximately 30-40 hours per week.
0-2 years of coding experience preferably in C/C++, Python, and/or Java for core engineering roles.
Self-starter, ability to envision solutions and take initiative to see the solution to the end despite challenges.
Ability to crystallize vague concepts into concise plans with clear documentation.
Detail-oriented, organized, ethical, responsible, and self-motivated.
Team player, ability to work effectively in a matrix organization.
Strong communication skills and a desire to learn something new.
A passion for creating products that resonate emotionally with people.
A passion for Zoom’s mission, vision, values, and culture.

Nice To Have
HTML/CSS/Javascript/jQuery/AJAX/Linux/SQL/MATLAB.
REST and Microservice Architecture.
Hands-on technical knowledge in Mac OS, Windows, G-Suite, Microsoft Office products, anti-malware, network, VPN, etc.

The Software Engineering team is responsible for building highly available production client and /or cloud applications for our emerging platform or application projects. Reporting to the Robot Software Engineering manager, the intern will be given one of the independent work projects to complete with guidance from their manager. Brooks Automation offers the industry’s most advanced and reliable robots for operation in vacuum and isolation environments. title: Software Development Intern
requirements:
Summary Of Internship

The Software Development Internship position provides an opportunity for engineering students who are currently pursuing a computer science, computer engineering, or like engineering degree to get hands on experience working with engineers in a fast-paced software design and software environment. The software intern will contribute to software development projects in creating design and innovation workshops, with the purpose of discovering new ways of working, providing innovation solutions, actions, and initiatives around field service management and customer experience. The position starts in June, paid working 40 hours per week through August.  Opportunity exists for this position to continue through the academic year on a part-time basis to allow for class schedules.

Essential Functions
Provide engineering support related to product development projects including testing and design
Provide support in business process analysis and mapping
Support a variety of software engineering activities and may be assigned to a variety of engineering tasks throughout the department
Be involved with many aspects of software design and analysis tasks
Provide feedback on specifications and designs
Learn about software engineering and instrumentation through daily activities.
Accept candid feedback and look for areas of improvements
Specific tasks will be tailored to the software interns experience level and abilities
A software intern works under the close supervision of engineers, project managers, and software engineering managers
Skills and Abilities
Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team in an Agile environment
Willingness to learn, be mentored, and improve
Desire to contribute and improve design of new and existing scientific instrumentation products
Exceptional customer focus
Desire to teach other engineers about technology in area of expertise
Familiarity with Front-end and back end engineering, Web development, data engineering and data science
Familiarity with of least one software development tool set such as C#, HTML and RPA Software
Aptitude for writing software programs

Qualifications
Pursing an undergrad Engineering Degree
Previous Internship Experience
Development experience with JAVA, Python is preferred

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

title: Software Engineering Intern
requirements:
Description:We are a dynamic and diverse team on a recurring multi-year, critical program, seeking a software development intern who likes to be challenged, solve problems, and be a contributing member of a highly skilled DevOps team. You will be on the leading edge focusing on technical analysis, software automation, and enhancements to systems currently under development to creatively solve our customer's needs.

As a member of our Code Name: “DogPatch” software team, you will work directly with domain experts and technical staff to support products integrated into Lockheed Martin “Skunk Work” product lines. While we can’t tell you what it’s for…once you’re briefed into the program, you’ll find it to be one of the most interesting and rewarding missions you could ever be part of!

Our intern experience focuses on building the ‘Next Generation of Engineer’. We assign a work ‘buddy’ to help you acclimate to the new team, set-up your development environment, support you with your work assignments and introduce you to your co-workers and peers to help you feel like a part of our team. You are supported by an Intern organization that hosts seminars to further your technical and professional business skills, creates social events and team building exercises, and collaborates on a ‘summer project’ to build upon your existing engineering skills. If this sounds like something you’d find interesting and exciting – joining the Lockheed Martin Rotary & Mission Systems could be the place for you!

Basic Qualifications

College student actively enrolled in a Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or other related degree program from an accredited college/university. You should be familiar with Object-Oriented programming or scripting languages. You should also have a good understanding of the constructs of software development principles along with good written and verbal communication skills.

Desired Skills

Prefer experience in a Windows environment using MS Visual Studio. Experience with Agile software development and/or tools such as JIRA, Jenkins, Confluence, GIT, and Bitbucket is a bonus.

Job.Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.

title: Software Engineer Intern, Insights
requirements:
Engineering is at the core of Addepar and we are looking to add the best, brightest, and most passionate software engineers to our team. If you are excited about doing the best work of your career and you enjoy the rush of shipping high quality code to production every day we’re excited to meet you! Our software engineers come from a variety of backgrounds, ranging from Silicon Valley entrepreneurs to finance tech veterans. What they have in common is tremendous talent and dedication to architecting, implementing, and shipping high quality software.

Intern Program Dates: May 24 - Aug 13, 2021

Our Engineering Teams
Data Engineering: build systems to ingest the world’s investment data and aggregate it into a single platform.
Infrastructure: build reliable services and work on monitoring systems, logging infrastructure, application and service security, release engineering, and operational tools.
Product Engineering: Addepar product engineering operates across a broad range of technologies and product domains. Work with a cross-functional team of engineering, product, and design staff to build the world’s most customizable financial reporting and analytics tool. Positions are open for interns to work on financial calculations, full-stack web projects, queuing and scheduling systems, UI/UX flows, and mobile-friendly web applications.


Requirements
Extraordinary talent in software engineering. Ability to write high quality object oriented code.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Working knowledge of development best practices and experience working in a team.
Ability to explore complex problems spaces objectively from multiple points of view.
General familiarity with some of the technologies we use:
HTTP, REST and web API best practices.
Modern JavaScript and/or Ember.js.
SQL, relational databases and key-value stores.
Messaging/queuing and transaction log frameworks.
Linux proficiency, basic shell scripting and a solid grasp of systems level programming is a plus.
Specific knowledge of Java, Python, Ember.js and/or JavaScript are a plus.
Specific experience in or knowledge of financial data systems is a plus.


Addepar is a wealth management platform that specializes in data aggregation, analytics and reporting for even the most complex investment portfolios. Founded in 2009 by Joe Lonsdale, who currently serves as an active Chairman of its Board of Directors and General Partner at 8VC, the company's platform aggregates portfolio, market and client data all in one place. It provides asset owners and advisors a clearer financial picture at every level, allowing them to make more informed and timely investment decisions. Addepar works with hundreds of leading financial advisors, family offices and large financial institutions that manage data for over $2 trillion of assets on the company's platform. In 2020, Addepar was named as a Forbes Fintech 50 company and honored as a member of the CB Insights Fintech 250. Addepar is headquartered in Silicon Valley and has offices in New York City and Salt Lake City. All brokerage services offered through Acervus Securities Inc., member FINRA / SIPC.

Addepar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek to bring together diverse ideas, experiences, skill sets, perspectives, backgrounds, and identities to drive innovative solutions. We commit to promoting a welcoming environment where inclusion and belonging are held as a shared responsibility.

In order to ensure the health and safety of all Addepeeps and our prospective candidates, we have instituted a virtual interview and onboarding experience.

title: Software Engineer Intern (Core Engineering) - Summer 2021
requirements:
There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.

We’re looking for dedicated students who share our passion for ground-breaking technology and want to create a lasting future for you and Snowflake.

What We Offer
Paid, full-time internships in the heart of the software industry

What We Expect

Data Infrastructure, Data Platform, Database Query Engine, Database Security, Data Governance, Data Services, FoundationDB, Manageability, Metadata, Multi-cloud, On-Line Transaction Processing (OLTP), and Service Runtime
High performance large-scale data processing
Large-scale distributed systems
Query compilation and optimization
Software-as-a-Service platform
Software frameworks for stability and performance testing


Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.

How do you want to make your impact?

title: Software Developer Summer College Intern
requirements:
A&F IT is a unit under the Executive Office for Administration & Finance (A&F) that is overseen by the A&F IT Chief Information Officer (A&F CIO). A&F IT is comprised of 189 employees working on IT systems and applications for 15 various A&F agencies.
One of the key agencies within A&F is the Department of Revenue (DOR). DOR manages Commonwealth taxes and child support, and their mission is to gain full compliance with the tax, child support and municipal finance laws of the Commonwealth.
A&F IT is looking to hire a highly motivated college intern to join its Business Applications Bureau as a software developer for work on its tax processing system, GeniSys. This intern will work during the summer months, from May through August.

Responsibilities

The software developer will work on the GeniSys development team alongside other developers and QA analysts. The intern will report to one of the development leads on the project to help implement innovative and high-quality solutions within the tax platform.

The Intern Will
Assist with the development of high-quality software in VB.Net to help met the project's needs
Assist to develop and analyze database queries in SQL server
Analyze code and dependencies in a configuration-based environment
Meet with business stakeholders to understand and document requirements
Provide testing on application solutions developed
Provide documentation for solutions developed
Job Skills & Qualifications
Working on a Bachelor's Degree in Computers, or related field
Knowledge of VB.Net and SQL Server
Highly energetic, enthusiastic and confident self-starter
Detail oriented and capable of independently tracking and following up on commitment
Excellent verbal, analytical and written communications skills
Ability to take responsibility and function under general supervision
Comfortable working with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio)
Knowledge and use of video conferencing software (such as MS Teams, Zoom, WebEx)
A candidate recommended for a position with the Department of Revenue will be subject to a background check that includes checks for: state and federal tax compliance; child support compliance; education verification; Massachusetts CORI checks; criminal background checks in state(s) of current and previous residence/employment; validation of eligibility to work in the United States; and national fingerprint-based criminal background checks.
First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.

Please See Preferred Qualifications.

An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.

title: 2021 Internships (Engineering, Computer Science, Technical)
requirements:
SEA CORP

Location: Middletown, RI
Req ID: req28
Employee Status: Full Time

2021 Internships (Engineering, Computer Science, Technical)

We are searching for candidates for our 2021 Internships (Engineering, Computer Science, Technical) at our Rhode Island and Connecticut sites.

SEA CORP is a veteran-owned business based in Middletown, Rhode Island. Founded in 1981, we have been providing services to the U.S. Navy for over 40 years. Our core business is providing systems, software, and hardware engineering services, as well as test and evaluation services to the Navy, chiefly for submarine electronic systems. We have enjoyed steady, planned growth for over three decades, and have grown to over 450 people with operations in multiple states. Our strength lies in our highly trained and professional staff who consistently exceed customer expectations.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

Depending upon the specific role and department an intern supports, there is a very wide variety of potential tasking to which an individual may be assigned. Some areas of focus are as follows:

Programming: work to support the development of software related to the services provided to government customers

Test and Evaluation: running and analyzing the results of test programs to validate ongoing work

Modeling: use SolidWorks or other programs to perform modeling tasking

Program Analysis: use a variety of technical tools to manage and analyze existing program data

Production: Support the production of low volume, highly technical manufacturing, including development of Work Instructions

The best intern candidates are extremely flexible in what they want to do, are focused on learning quickly and applying knowledge to the task at hand, are inherently curious about the work they do, can maintain strict confidentiality, are accustomed to meeting deadlines, have a track record of producing quality results in anything they do, and have the ability to seamlessly work with a wide variety of people.

Travel:

None

Work Environment & Physical Demands:

Office & Computer Laboratories - This positions requires the following physical activities: Sitting, standing, extended periods of time using a mouse and keyboard and looking at computer screens. Infrequent lifting of

Eligibility Requirements:

Education: Currently matriculating in a Bachelors-level program, preferably in an Engineering discipline, Computer Science, or similar technical-heavy curriculum.
Experience: Prior internship experience preferred but not required. All positions require at least an Intermediate level of MS Excel use (e.g. VLOOKUPs, charts, significant use of formulas, etc.). Programming and modeling-heavy roles may require specific language/program knowledge.
Clearance Required: Secret

Successful candidates will enjoy competitive wages and a very rich benefit program, including:

Retirement Benefits: A qualified 401(k) Retirement Savings Account with a generous employer matching contribution up to 8% of your eligible compensation. We offer a variety of investment options so that each employee can customize their portfolio according to their own investment style and free investment advising provided by a well-respected financial firm to help employees make critical retirement planning decisions. Our plan allows for rollover contributions from your previous employers and after-tax (Roth) contributions, all within IRS guidelines.

requirements:
Engineering Intern

Location WA, Lynnwood

Department Engineering

Employment Type Full Time

Crane Aerospace & Electronics has a unique and exciting career opportunity for an Electrical Engineer, Power Electronics Intern on the Sensing & Power Systems Engineering Team at our Lynnwood, WA campus.

Students enrolled in accredited Universities with specific Power Electronics Programs are highly desired and will be given top consideration.

Electrical Engineer Intern Position Overview

The EE Intern will perform engineering duties in researching, planning, designing, documenting and developing electronic or electrical products and systems used for a manufactured product or transmission. Electrical engineers carry out extensive analyses on new product designs to ensure efficiency, reliability and quality. The EE Intern will use computer-assisted engineering, design and analysis software and equipment to perform daily assignments. Electrical engineering principles and techniques will be applied to develop economical solutions to technical problems.

Electrical Engineer Intern Responsibilities
Performs engineering work in basic and applied research, development/design of new or sustaining products.
Work includes the design, fabrication, modification and evaluation of electronic apparatus, components, or circuits for use within electronics and/or aerospace equipment, devices, and systems.
Perform detailed circuit analysis to verify design compliance to specific performance targets. Analysis to include computer aided modeling and the generation of schematics.
Prepare and review technical reports/documentation necessary to satisfy customer, internal and program requirements, including specifications, design documents, test plans/procedures, reports, correspondence, etc.
Provide diagnostic support to manufacturing on new and existing products.


Likely Projects
Motor Controller:
Analysis & documentation of Modularity Concept
Simulating and modelling of controller, motor, and pump dynamics
Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) case studies for applying MBSE to Crane systems and products including writing & validating requirements using models
Reliability Improvements
Research fielded performance versus predicted performance
Common failure modes for fielded products based on field returns
Environmental Stress Screening (ESS) profiles vs. infant mortalities of products


Minimum Qualifications
Must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university in Electrical Engineering.
Must provide GPA, minimum accepted 3.1 on a 4.0 scale
Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
Possess effective interpersonal skills in a team environment
Must be project-oriented and be able to multi-task
Knowledge/proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, including Microsoft PowerPoint
Ability to fulfill a one quarter or semester internship commitment, 40 hours per week
Available to work full-time during the agreed upon semester session


Employment Eligibility Requirement
This position requires access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor we are bound by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations ( ITAR ).


About Crane

Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You'll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS).

We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniquesto optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value.

As an intern at Crane Aerospace & Electronics, you will develop knowledge about the business through exposure to a functional area (such as manufacturing, engineering, and lean principles). You will focus on developing the skills necessary for success by assisting employees with day-to-day job assignments. You may be assigned to additional training or project work. The Company's internship program is intended to provide students from diverse backgrounds with the opportunity to practice business skills learned in school while gaining work experience.

The intern will have a unique experience of interacting directly with senior level engineers working on products in various stages of their life cycle. The intern will get exposure to research, design, development, and production. Responsibilities and tasks will be tailored to the applicant's abilities.

Crane Aerospace & Electronics offers competitive salaries and outstanding opportunities for career growth and development.

In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check prior to employment.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work being performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Crane Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity characteristics or expression, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, or U.S. military or veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law, in recruiting, hiring, training and promoting.

title: Engineering Intern
requirements:
Overview

The Engineering Intern will lead or participate in projects related to designing and improving manufacturing processes, testing and qualifying advanced technology, and supporting the development of product testing systems hardware and software. The Engineering Intern may utilize project management skills to implement new operational processes and equipment. The intern assists the business unit in meeting its strategic goals and may lead/support kaizen events, lean work cell design, cost improvement projects, DMAIC projects, capital expenditure projects and supply chain initiatives.

Roles and Responsibilities will vary by Creation business unit location, but may include the following:
Research and evaluate product defects and processes to improve cost, efficiency, quality, and reliability
Analyze product designs for compatibility with assembly and test processes, and recommend appropriate design changes
Coordinate with other engineering staff to complete projects
Detailed roles and responsibilities will be outlined dependent on business Group, location and the project outlined
Expectations: The intern will be expected to work full-time at 40 hours/week and will be compensated on an hourly basis.


Essential Job Functions
Assists department in developing, evaluating, and improving manufacturing methods.
Helps with the analyzing and planning resource utilization, space requirements, and workflow; and designs layout of equipment and workspace for maximum efficiency.
Prepares and maintains manufacturing documentation (Bill of Material, Bill of Process, Assembly Instructions) for new and existing products in manufacturing.
Applies statistical methods to analyze, root cause, and improve quality and productivity for manufactured products.
Assess production validation runs against performance metrics
Develop Process Failure Mode Effects and Analysis in a cross functional group


Skills And Experience
Applicant must be currently enrolled and pursuing a degree in Industrial Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related/equivalent field.
Minimum GPA requirement of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
Good problem-solving skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work in teams, and perform planning, organizing, and leading activities
Strong interpersonal skills
Basic Statistics and Design of Experiment

title: Intern, SW Engineering
company: Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America, Inc.
requirements:
Embedded in a worldwide network Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America continuously strives to remain at the forefront of successful automotive research and development. MBRDNA is headquartered in Silicon Valley, California, with key areas of Autonomous Driving, Advanced Interaction Design, Digital User Experience, Machine Learning, Customer Research, and Open Innovation. In Redford, Michigan, the focus is on Powertrain and eDrive technology as well as in Long Beach, where the teams test durability of the latest driver assistant and telematic systems. The Digital Hub in Seattle focusses on developing a cloud architecture and building out the cloud platform for the next generation of connected car services. The Testing and Regulatory Affairs Division in Ann Arbor and the Advanced Vehicle Design in Carlsbad complete the competence center.

During your internship you will be supporting engineering projects for voice applications in Daimler ecosystems and vehicles. You will be responsible for prototype software and contribute to feature and functional specifications.

Key Tasks & Responsibilities
Software Development and testing of progressive and regressive features for the Digital Voice Assistants (Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant Mercedes me integration)
Conceptualize, develop and write software architectures and implementations for IoT technologies
Document technical software solutions or specifications
Coordinate and participate testing, validation, debugging of software and system architecture
Collaborate with other engineers, designers and user experience experts to find solutions software implementation and integration tasks
Develop new software prototypes and mass production frameworks
Integrate and test software in prototyping cars or demonstration hardware
Actively demonstrate cross-functional collaboration with other engineers, designers, user experience experts and researchers

Education & Experience
Enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree in Software/Computer Engineering or Engineering and Natural Science with additional Computer Science knowledge (or equivalent)
Strong understanding of operating systems and computer architecture fundamentals. Java or JavaScript / NodeJS, RESTful API, MySQL, NoSQL.
Experience in iOS or Android apps development.
Experience integrating 3rd party API/SDK in iOS/Android Apps.
Ability to analyze complex problems, recognizes and explains connections between cause-and-effect understandably and develops concrete, viable solutions taking risks and obstacles into account.
Ability to work in inter-cultural, inter-disciplinary teams across multiple time zones. Able to learn quickly and willing to share knowledge.
Attention to detail, Strong Team player.
Open to international travel, for approximately 10% of the time.

Preferred Qualifications
Good Knowledge about Digital Voice Assistants (Google Assistant, Amazon Alexa, Apple Siri and others)
Understanding of design patterns and software architecture
Multiple apps published in Apple and Google app stores
Java, C/C++, JavaScript, Python, Swift, Objective-C
Experience with location based services
Knowledge in Backend and embedded car system technologies

Why should you apply?

Here at MBRDNA, you create digital ecosystems around cars, you design a language between humans and machines, you make a car even more intelligent - you make the new reality for cars. Our benefits include medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k savings plan, tuition and fitness reimbursement programs and much more. We have an open and flexible environment to allow you to push boundaries, join MBRDNA and design your future.

MBRDNA is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.

MBRDNA only accepts resumes from approved agencies who have a valid Agency Agreement on file. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, MBRDNA employees, or send to any MBRDNA location. MBRDNA is not responsible for any fees or claims related to receipt of unsolicited resumes.

Thank you for your interest in Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America. Please be aware the impact of COVID-19 could increase the amount of time it takes our HR and Hiring Team to process your application. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. We are dedicated to the health and safety of our employees and candidates. We appreciate your patience during this time.

Mercedes-Benz Research and Development North America, Inc.

We collect information about all visitors to this website in log files. title: Software – Full Stack Engineering Internship, Integration and Tools (Summer 2021)
requirements:
Disclaimer: This position is expected to start in May/June 2021 and continue for a minimum of 12 weeks, up to a maximum of 12 months. Please consider availability before submitting an application.

Internship Programs at Tesla

The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year-round program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by given them projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission.

Locations
Palo Alto, CA


About The Team

The Systems Integration Team owns the architecture and design that enables all of Tesla’s vehicle systems to work in unison. Our multidisciplinary team is on the forefront of new vehicle development, and contributes cross functionally to a variety of areas, including hardware, firmware, and more.

We are currently looking for a full stack software engineering intern to build highly leveraged tools to bolster our integration systems. This will entail building full stack systems for real time vehicle data streams, manipulation of vehicle data across both the global and prototype fleets, and building services to allow Tesla’s engineering organization to develop, validate, and iterate more quickly.

Responsibilities
Create, maintain and expand design of Tesla’s internal engineering tools related to harnesses, devices, vehicles, factory diagnostics, and vehicle firmware
Participate in next generation feature and tool development, system architecture definition, end-to-end implementation from early prototype to full production release
Own and support existing software and hardware tools by scaling them for use across the entire engineering organization worldwide while maintaining reliability
Write translators (APIs) between applications and various internal and third-party design software packages
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement architectural improvements for faster engineering design cycle iterations


Requirements
Pursuing a BS/MS degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or equivalent with some courses in electronics/electrical engineering
Python development experience (2.x, 3.x)
Experience with web technologies and web frameworks (React/Node/Dash/PHP/CSS, etc.)
Experience with workflow management platforms (Airflow or similar)
Basic knowledge of stream processing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ, or similar)
Experience with scalable map-reduce data processing preferred (Spark, Hadoop, or similar)
Basic knowledge of machine learning and data analytics
Experience with at least one of MySQL/Postgres/NoSQL databases
Experience with containerization (Docker or similar)
Experience with build systems, automation, continuous integration (Rundeck, Jenkins or similar)
Experience in building highly scalable architectures
Experience working in a number of different projects

requirements:
Introduction
Imagine the future you could help us build.

Teamwork, not just tech work. We are tech futurists and business geniuses. Together, we solve problems to make daily life easier. We are looking for a few more great minds to join our team as we continue to grow one of the world's leading consumer robot companies.

Together, we empower people to do more.

Improving the reliability and stability of our tools and build process

Available for a full time summer 2021 internship

title: Software Development Intern
requirements:
At Sonos, we're passionate about creating the finest high fidelity audio experiences in the world for our customers. Our integration partners share our passion and build compelling experiences that showcase their ingenuity alongside our own.

The lever that moves this world: our software and the strategic partnerships we have with some of the largest music and voice partners in the world. Be part of the team building the next generation of software experiences as part of the Sonos system which brings unique sound & music experiences to smart, internet-connected homes.

Our software teams write the embedded software at the heart of our products. They build the Sonos sound platform and partner integrations that create the magic of our customer experience with their Sonos system. They develop the Sonos mobile applications that allow our customers to access and play the content they love.

If any of this sounds like fun, read on and let’s connect soon!

What You’ll Do

Our software engineers work on a cross-functional team to design and build product features and capabilities. We’d love for you to help us with any of the following:
Build world class speaker products and solve challenges in areas involving embedded software development for multi-room audio processing, networking, security and user experience.
Work on the next generation of services and APIs for controlling the Sonos system as part of a smart, internet-connected home.
Empower our users to listen better by making it easy to access new, relevant content.
Add new features to the mobile applications that let our users control and listen to their audio content on their system.
You’ll also use and gain experience in the following:
Using Scrum principles by participating in daily standup meetings, weekly grooming sessions, and other meetings.
Working alongside a mentor, manager, and other teammates who can provide expectations and support, as well as testers, product managers and user experience designers.
Having excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Being willing to challenge yourself, ask questions, and learn from setbacks.

Skills You’ll Need

Basic Qualifications

We are looking for interns in any of the following areas, with experience or interest in one of the following:
Embedded Software: C/C++, Audio Processing, Networking, Security
Cloud Platform: Java, NodeJS, AWS, IoT, Kubernetes, Machine Learning and NLP
App Development: Kotlin, Swift, Java, Objective-C, C++

title: Software Engineer Intern - Summer 2021
requirements:
Description

About Silicon Labs:

We are Silicon Labs. We are the leading provider of silicon, software and solutions for a smarter, more connected world.

We hire the most innovative talent in the world to solve the industry’s toughest problems, providing our customers with significant advantages in performance, energy savings, connectivity and design simplicity. Silicon Labs’ software and mixed signal engineering teams create solutions for customers in diverse markets including the Internet of Things, (IoT), internet infrastructure, TV tuners, as well as automotive and consumer radios. Our solutions are in products from the market leaders in home automation, electric vehicles, green technology, smart TVs and home voice control automation. We take pride in our products and in our people, and that’s one of the many reasons we continue to be awarded Most Respected Public Semiconductor Company by the Global Semiconductor Alliance.

Our Software Engineers, solve real-world problems within a small, collaborative team of the industry’s most innovative talent. As a Silicon Labs Intern, you will help develop the industry’s leading products in IoT and Infrastructure and Automotive (I&A) all while being mentored and closely guided by the best engineers who have a vested interest in your success. And don’t worry, you’ll still have plenty of opportunities to learn, network, and develop new skills through our social events, development lectures, and volunteer opportunities.

Excited? See what it’s like to be a part of the Silicon Labs Team
bit.ly/SiliconLabsInterns
bit.ly/WomenatSilabs
bit.ly/WhySilabsInternship

What You’ll Do

Projects are specifically tailored to each intern, ensuring a meaningful contribution to both your skillset and Silicon Labs. Here are just a few of the challenges you might get to tackle:
Work towards GUI development and cloud connectivity for innovative home automation products based around Silicon Labs wireless networking ICs.
Design, program and debug PC & embedded software applications to assist in the automated verification and validation of IOT IC products and writing debugging test scripts to help our Thread SQA team by automating Thread Test harnesses.
Write firmware for products that support multiple digital radio broadcasting standards, for various geographic regions, such as DAB/DAB+ (Europe, Australia), DMB (S. Korea), HD-Radio (US), DRM (India, Brazil, S. Africa), and CDR (China).
Develop, test, and maintain HAL and low-level software platform as a member of the Wireless MCU HAL team.
Learn more about the I&A (Timing, Isolation, Power) products and IoT (Wireless, MCU, Sensors) products you’ll be working with.

Who You Are

You are an innovator, builder, and tinkerer. You have a curious mind and a drive to succeed. You want to work with a global team of technology enthusiasts and design pioneers. Here’s what you need:
Completion of 2+ years of study
Enrollment in BS/MS/PhD Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
Coursework in embedded programming (C), scripting, or MCUs as well as exposure to web development languages and tools
You have some combination of the following skills:
Exposure to development tools for embedded systems such as analyzers, oscilloscopes, traffic generators, JTAG, etc. is a plus.
Experience with assembly language of at least one microcontroller such as the ARM, AVR, MSP430 or 8051
Experience using both simulations and hardware testing a plus
Familiarity of Python, User Interface (UI)/User Experience (UX) design, Object Orientated design, TCP/IP Networking, Bluetooth, Zigbee, or Z-wave

What’s in a World-Class Internship?

Take It From Our Previous Interns

Apply what you’ve learned in school to build technology that solves some of the planet’s most significant challenges. You will join a community of fellow interns and alumni who engage and empower your excellence.

“Everyone in that I met was incredibly welcoming. The team I worked on was especially welcoming and helped me with all the questions I had. They were always more than willing to help. I really enjoyed working with each of them.”– 2019 Software Engineer Intern

"I enjoyed the work I did and feel like I was able to learn a lot. But, one of the things I enjoyed the most about working at Silicon Labs was the atmosphere. It was an incredibly enjoyable work atmosphere to be a part of and that can be really hard to find. The interns here were treated so well, and really like we were part of the team." – 2019 Software Engineer Intern

Curious for more feedback? Check out our Glassdoor (bit.ly/SilabsGlassdoor)

bit.ly/SilabsUR -> Discover why we attract the best and brightest!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Software Engineering Intern
requirements:
About The Role And About You

As a Software Engineer Intern, you will be working together with eCommerce, Payments, and Support teams to build and maintain our customer experiences around our shop, maintaining subscriptions, and supporting customer's needs on Zwift. You will collaborate in cross-functional teams including teammates from our engineering, product, design, operations, and support disciplines. We are looking for someone comfortable in this highly collaborative environment, working with ambiguity, and being an agent of change to help build a world-class experience for our customers.

Throughout this internship, you’ll be mentored by our Engineering Managers.

A freight industry veteran founded Kuebix in 2008 with the vision of leveraging the latest cloud technology to build a transportation management system (TMS) that enabled supply chain visibility, stakeholder collaboration and predictive analytics. That vision was realized when the Kuebix team of freight and technology experts launched Kuebix TMS, a next generation multi-tenant cloud TMS that provides true freight intelligence.

We are looking for a highly motivated candidate who is interested in revolutionizing the world of medical robotics.

Job Responsibilities:
- Work with software, firmware, and other engineers (clinical, systems, mechanical, electrical) as part of a focused cross-functional team developing and testing software for medical robotic applications
- Develop software prototypes in C++ and test on the robotic system
- Perform hands-on system integration testing
- Develop firmware update tools and manufacturing support
- Solve technical issues including hardware and software anomalies
- Participate in design discussions and code reviews

title: Engineering Intern
requirements:
Crane Aerospace & Electronics has a unique and exciting career opportunity for an Electrical Engineer, Power Electronics Intern on the Sensing & Power Systems Engineering Team at our Lynnwood, WA campus.

Students enrolled in accredited Universities with specific Power Electronics Programs are highly desired and will be given top consideration.

Electrical Engineer Intern Position Overview

The EE Intern will perform engineering duties in researching, planning, designing, documenting and developing electronic or electrical products and systems used for a manufactured product or transmission. Electrical engineers carry out extensive analyses on new product designs to ensure efficiency, reliability and quality. The EE Intern will use computer-assisted engineering, design and analysis software and equipment to perform daily assignments. Electrical engineering principles and techniques will be applied to develop economical solutions to technical problems.

Electrical Engineer Intern Responsibilities
Performs engineering work in basic and applied research, development/design of new or sustaining products.
Work includes the design, fabrication, modification and evaluation of electronic apparatus, components, or circuits for use within electronics and/or aerospace equipment, devices, and systems.
Perform detailed circuit analysis to verify design compliance to specific performance targets. Analysis to include computer aided modeling and the generation of schematics.
Prepare and review technical reports/documentation necessary to satisfy customer, internal and program requirements, including specifications, design documents, test plans/procedures, reports, correspondence, etc.
Provide diagnostic support to manufacturing on new and existing products.


Likely Projects
Motor Controller:
Analysis & documentation of Modularity Concept
Simulating and modelling of controller, motor, and pump dynamics
Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) case studies for applying MBSE to Crane systems and products including writing & validating requirements using models
Reliability Improvements
Research fielded performance versus predicted performance
Common failure modes for fielded products based on field returns
Environmental Stress Screening (ESS) profiles vs. infant mortalities of products


Minimum Qualifications
Must be actively pursuing a Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university in Electrical Engineering.
Must provide GPA, minimum accepted 3.1 on a 4.0 scale
Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
Possess effective interpersonal skills in a team environment
Must be project-oriented and be able to multi-task
Knowledge/proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, including Microsoft PowerPoint
Ability to fulfill a one quarter or semester internship commitment, 40 hours per week
Available to work full-time during the agreed upon semester session


Employment Eligibility Requirement
This position requires access to controlled data or information and therefore only US persons will be considered. As a US Department of Defense contractor we are bound by the International Traffic in Arms Regulations ( ITAR ).


About Crane

Crane Aerospace & Electronics supplies critical systems and components to the aerospace and defense markets. You’ll find Crane Aerospace & Electronics in some of the toughest environments: from engines to landing gear; from satellites to medical implants and from missiles to unmanned aerial systems (UAS).

We are committed to operational excellence and world class processes. We employ Lean manufacturing techniques to optimize manufacturing efficiency and accuracy on all product lines. Our products are known for their technical strength, proven reliability and overall value.

As an intern at Crane Aerospace & Electronics, you will develop knowledge about the business through exposure to a functional area (such as manufacturing, engineering, and lean principles). You will focus on developing the skills necessary for success by assisting employees with day-to-day job assignments. You may be assigned to additional training or project work. The Company's internship program is intended to provide students from diverse backgrounds with the opportunity to practice business skills learned in school while gaining work experience.

The intern will have a unique experience of interacting directly with senior level engineers working on products in various stages of their life cycle. The intern will get exposure to research, design, development, and production. Responsibilities and tasks will be tailored to the applicant’s abilities.

Crane Aerospace & Electronics offers competitive salaries and outstanding opportunities for career growth and development.

In our efforts to maintain a safe and drug-free workplace, Crane Aerospace & Electronics requires that candidates complete a satisfactory background check prior to employment.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work being performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Crane Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity characteristics or expression, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, medical condition, genetic information, or U.S. military or veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law, in recruiting, hiring, training and promoting.

title: Software Engineering Intern (100% Remote)
requirements:
Job Title

Software Engineering Intern (100% Remote)

Role Overview

McAfee is hiring a few Software Engineering Interns for our Enterprise Products side of the business. This intern will be collaborating in real McAfee product extending support for new 3rd Party integrations. This experience will immerse the students in the world of Data Ingestion and Content Delivery to customers. This intern will be working together with Engineering team to extend product API used by our customers and will learn hands on practice about cybersecurity, technologies, tools and software development life cycle. This is a summer internship, full time and 100% remote.

Company Overview

From device to cloud, McAfee provides market-leading cybersecurity solutions for both business and consumers. We help businesses orchestrate cyber environments that are truly integrated, where protection, detection, and correction of security threats happen simultaneously. For consumers, McAfee secures your devices against viruses, malware, and other threats, both at home and away. We want to continue to shape the future of cybersecurity by working together to build best in class products and solutions.

About The Role

The efficacy a security information and event management system (SIEM) rely on its ability to view and analyze data from a wide variety of sources. This information is used for threat detection, advanced analytics and during the investigation process within a security operations team. McAfee Enterprise Security Manager (ESM) covers a vast number of data sources (400+) but needs to expand its coverage across SaaS solutions. ESM provides real time visibility into activity, advanced threat intelligence and embedded compliance framework for clients. Our current focus is on closing gaps in IaaS and SaaS visibility (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP etc.), as well as across commonly used SaaS applications such as Salesforce, Box, Workday, Dropbox, ServiceNow and others.
Trained on technical concepts and general processes
Participate in ingestion/collection and normalization for new sources.
Generating packages to deliver security specific content to customers including correlation rules, views, watchlists, notifications.
Interpreting exiting communication method between server and browser to convert to new format
Collaborate in real McAfee product extending support for new 3rd Party integrations
Learn about Data Ingestion and Content Delivery to customers.
Work together with engineering team to extend product API used by our customers.
Learn by hands on practice about Cybersecurity, technologies, tools and Software Development Life Cycle.
Participate in a real word project with real problems to solve but in a controlled working environment.
Develop analytical and problem-solving skills
Integration with the Project team by interacting with other pairs in order to get support to complete the assigned tasks.
Get exposed to Software Engineering Agile methodologies

About You
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s Degree in System Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering or related. Master's Degrees not preferred at this time.
Classes in software development, infrastructure or software as a service (IAAS or SAAS), or application programming interfaces (API). Classes in agile is highly preferred
Ability to work in a team oriented, collaborative environment, starting remotely
Comfortable with presenting ideas to the team formally and impromptu
Desire to learn new technologies and concepts
Strong verbally and written communication skills. Strong presenter.
This position will be 100% remote
Must be authorized to work without visa (CPT) restrictions

Company Benefits And Perks

We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at McAfee to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We offer a variety of social programs, flexible work hours and family-friendly benefits to all of our employees.
Pension and Retirement Plans
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
Paid Time Off
Paid Parental Leave
Support for Community Involvement

We're serious about our commitment to diversity which is why McAfee prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

We are committed to creating an organization of inclusion and diversity, where everyone feels involved, respected, valued and connected, and where everyone is free to bring their authentic selves and ideas.

HYPACK®, a Xylem brand, develops Windows-based software for the hydrographic and dredging industries. HYPACK was founded in 1984 as a small hydrographic consultancy. Today, HYPACK is one of the most widely used hydrographic surveying packages in the world, with more than 10,000 users. HYPACK provides surveyors and dredgers with the software tools needed to design, collect, process, analyze, and generate mapping products for ocean, coastal, and inland waters.

The Role: HYPACK, A Xylem Brand is seeking Intern Candidates with a Software Engineering background to join our team. The successful candidate will have demonstrated the ability to succeed in a fast-paced, fluid environment, while ensuring that project initiatives are met. title: Software Engineering Intern
requirements:
Description

Humatics Summer 2021 Internship will be a virtual experience which we had much success with during our Summer 2020 Internship program.

Just as GPS drove huge gains in efficiency and safety throughout the transit and rail industries, Humatics’ microlocation technology delivers centimeter or better performance in environments where GPS doesn’t work. We’re eager to meet enthusiastic, engaged people wanting to join our team and help create the microlocation revolution.

Humatics Rail Navigation system — using simple radio-frequency technology, sensor fusion, and a solutions-oriented approach — pinpoints trains with subcentimeter precision, accelerating signal modernization, improving revenue service reliability, reducing system maintenance, expediting completion of capital programs, and enhancing worker, rider and system safety through a variety of applications that build upon a single microlocation foundation.

What You Will Be Working On

At Humatics, you will create a positive and lasting impact on the business and will receive support, coaching, and training from a diverse group of engineers.

You will be responsible for one or more projects involving product development, product testing, development of internal and customer-facing user interfaces, backend development or advanced application development. We are excited to work with passionate individuals who are enthusiastic to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment.

Who You Are
You are a Software Engineering Undergrad in your Junior or Senior year or a Graduate Student earning your Masters.
You posses Software engineering experience (e.g. ios and android mobile app development).
You have basic data analysis skills (e.g. plotting and statistical analysis in python).
You have experience analyzing or developing algorithms for sensor data (a plus).
You are excited to work with cutting edge RF sensor technology.
You understand basic experimental procedures (e.g. can document experimental procedures and results).
You are self-motivated and creative with a passion for technology, collaboration and creative problem-solving.
You geek out over crafting world-class software.
You are able to work full time, 37.5 hours per week, beginning in Summer 2021.

Why You’d Want to Spend Your Summer With Us (Virtually)

At Humatics we put Humans first. We strive to create an amazing internship program that benefits both the Humatics Team and our interns. Not only will you gain valuable real-world experience with a team of engineers from a diverse background, but you will also have the ability to influence the work we do here at Humatics, and contribute to products which contribute to more productive and humane technology.

title: 2021 Summer Software Development Engineer Intern - Games
requirements:
Description

Note: By applying to this position, your application will be considered for locations we hire for in the United States including, but not limited to: Seattle, WA; Austin, TX; Bay Area, CA; Bellevue, WA; Boston, MA; Denver, CO; Detroit, MI; Herndon, VA; Irvine, CA; New York, NY; Madison, WI; Minneapolis, MN; Phoenix, AZ; Portland, OR; San Diego, CA. You may be considered for a role outside of Amazon Games.

Amazon is all in on games.
Do you want the chance to solve a real world business challenge? Are you fascinated with connecting players with games they will enjoy? Do you possess strong analytical, design, and problem solving skills? Do you enjoy working with data, algorithms, and gamers? If you are not afraid of ambiguity, thinking outside the box, or complex challenges, this might be the internship for you.

We believe the evolution that began with pre-internet arcade communities a quarter at a time, growing to the live streams and eSports of today, will continue to a future in which fans are creators, players are celebrities, and games are a global cultural touchstone that cuts across age, gender and nationality. Games have the power to connect communities at a massive scale, and we want to be a part of that future by delivering great customer experiences to players, viewers, streamers, and game developers. If you share our belief that games will produce some of the future’s most influential voices in media and art, come join us.

We are looking for future Amazon interns to join us for summer 2021. You will be given the opportunity to have direct impact on an Amazon game currently under development or the evolution of game services to delight gamers, streamers, and viewers. You will be part of a team of talented and experienced engineers who are building and operating massively scalable services while developing delightful gamer experiences. And finally you will have the satisfaction of being able to look back and say you were a contributor to mission critical projects early in your career. Your design, code, and raw smarts will contribute to solving some of the most complex technical challenges in the areas of distributed systems, data mining, automation, optimization, scalability, and security - to name a few.

Working As a Part Of a Game Team In a Highly Collaborative Environment, You'll Own And Deliver a Project From One Of The Following Areas
Building games, products, and projects that matter to our customers
Designing and implementing a new feature or service to delight our Prime Gaming customers
Designing and implementing a new gameplay system or game feature
Designing and implementing features or services that help connect game developers to players, viewers, and streamers
Designing and implementing a reliable, scalable, and high-performance service or tool to enable gameplay experiences
In addition to an impactful project, you will have the opportunity to engage with Amazonians in both personal and professional development, expand your network, and take part in fun activities throughout the summer. No matter the location of your internship, we give you the tools to own your summer and learn in a real world setting. Many of our technologies overlap – you would be hard pressed to find a team that is not using Amazon Web Services (AWS), leveraging the catalogue, or iterating services to better personalize for customers.

If this excites you, come build the future with us.

Amazon internships are full-time (40 hours/week) for 12 consecutive weeks with start dates between May and September 2020. Applicants should have at a minimum one quarter/semester remaining after their internship concludes.

Key Job Responsibilities
Collaborate with experienced cross-disciplinary Amazonians to develop, design, and bring to market innovative devices and services
Design and build innovative technologies in a large distributed computing environment and help lead fundamental changes in the industry
Create solutions to run predictions on distributed systems with exposure to cutting-edge technologies at incredible scale and speed
Build distributed storage, index, and query systems that are scalable, fault-tolerant, low cost, and easy to manage/use

Basic Qualifications
Programming experience with one of the following Python, Javascript, C++/C# (including object-oriented design, if C++/C#)
Currently enrolled in an Associate’s, Bachelor's or higher degree program in Stem related field such as IT, Computer Science, Computer Engineering
Demonstrated interest in online video games (playing, building, streaming, viewing)
Preferred Qualifications
Enrolled in, or received BA degree in Computer Science
Strong understanding objective-oriented design, data structures, and algorithms
Experience in one or more object-orientated programming languages (C#, C++)
Ability to articulate technical challenges and solutions
Adept at handling ambiguous or undefined challenges through strong problem solving skills and effective communication
Experience in games industry

title: Intern - Software Development
requirements:
Job Number: 30044

Position Title: Intern

Your Opportunity

External Description:

Imagine yourself working for the leading independent software provider focused on delivering transformative innovation for the future of all things data. Organizations around the world rely on Informatica to realize their information potential and drive top business imperatives. As a University Graduate at Informatica, you will be exposed to innovative culture, challenging work and a fast moving, results oriented environment. As a software development engineer, you will be responsible for creating and certifying code for Informatica’s next generation platform to handle the volume, velocity and variety of structured and unstructured data. It could be enterprise and partner data from hosted cloud services and on-premise deployments or arbitrary data from social web sites and media.

Our Ideal Candidate

You are a self-motivated professional who demonstrates the ability to quickly grasp new technologies and products in addition to solving complex problems. You are bright and intellectually curious; deal with concepts and complexity comfortably; are capable, adaptable and agile. You like the excitement of working in a fast-paced environment. You like being creative and are open to new ideas and ways of doing things. You are able to work independently as well as within a team spanning multiple regions.

Technically, We Expect You To Have
Strong programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Java, JavaScript, C, C++, Python
Knowledge in Relational databases concepts
Object Oriented design, data structures and programming
Experience with jQuery or other JavaScript frameworks
Operating Systems, multi-threading and algorithm knowledge is preferred

In Addition, You Have The Following Attributes
Ability to quickly learn new technologies in a dynamic environment
Strong Analytical and problem solving skills
Accurately assess critical factors for success and mitigate risk on deliverables
Proactively share technical knowledge and best practices with team members
Possess excellent written and verbal skills
Articulate ideas and thoughts clearly and easily
Interact well with team leaders, peers, junior staff and other managers at various positions

City: Redwood City

State: California

Seniority Level: Entry Level

Alternative Location(s) :

Community / Marketing Title: Intern - Software Development



Company Profile

Unleash Your Potential

A career with Informatica gives you all the opportunities and benefits that can only come from working for the trusted industry leader. By joining our team, you'll be able to solve real-life problems, make a difference, have a global impact, and join a supportive group of globally diverse teammates. We encourage you to be yourself, grow with us and unleash your potential.

EEO Employer Verbiage

Informatica is the enterprise cloud data management leader, helping enterprises overcome critical business challenges by leading with the power of data. Processing over 15 trillion cloud transactions a month, Informatica enables the world’s most innovative companies to take a cloud-first, cloud-native approach to modernize their data infrastructure, gain a 360-degree view of their business, and drive data governance and privacy. Informatica is the market leader in all five key categories of enterprise data management and has been the trusted partner to more than 9,500 customers. Connect with Informatica at www.informatica.com, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook.

Conquering the Impossible with data, come join #LifeAtINFA!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Travel Requirement: Limited

title: Intern Program – Software and Manufacturing Engineering
requirements:
About ProbiusDx Inc.

We are Probius, an emerging venture-backed life science company developing next generation biochemical analysis solutions that combine quantum sensing and AI. Our technology yields a high-fidelity digital representation of the biochemistry of health for more detailed and predictive insights.

At Probius, we hire the most innovative talent to enable our partners and customers with solutions for their most challenging bioanalysis problems and we strive to extend the boundaries of what is possible. We foster the spirit of innovation by promoting responsible risk taking, open-mindedness, scientific excellence and integrity, open communication, and accountability as individuals and as a team. We are nimble, gritty, and unafraid to explore outside our comfort zone, and motivated to enable human wellness through deep technology and scientific discoveries, while maintaining a healthy work/life balance.

Intern With Us

Our Internship program is 10 weeks long starting in June 2021. All positions are paid hourly with an average work week of 40 hours. We recruit interns for various functions across the company. In addition to your daily work, you will be given the opportunity for weekly knowledge sessions with the company leadership, and activities with other Probius interns and the opportunity to present to the leadership team at the end of the program.

The Role

As software development Intern in a company bringing cutting-edges solutions at the intersection of life sciences and technology, you will have the opportunity to immerse yourself in multiple design and innovation projects under the direction of a highly skilled and tight-knit team where every engineer, product manager and scientist make a significant impact on customer solutions. As you become part of a startup organization, you will also have a lot of room to create and grow with plenty of autonomy and learning opportunity by getting exposed to all the stages of a product in our manufacturing and quality process. You will get a chance to show your attention to detail and passion for the development of software and automation directed to manufacturing engineering and productivity improvement which could open the door to a full-time position and the opportunity to join the Probius family as the first step in your career.

For this specific internship period, some of your responsibilities will include:
Develop software scripts that boost productivity in the fab and the lab
Connect and program various hardware to create a robotic handler to perform parametric tests and output measurements to a database
Script routines to automatically register & measure image features and output measurements to a database
Develop and leverage classification algorithms to support inspection and quality assurance workflows
Apply your knowledge in a real-world business application
Participate in a structured teamwork with the opportunity to practice reporting and presentation skills

Minimum Qualifications
In 3rd or 4th year of college graduate BS or BA programs. Students working towards MSc. And PhD degrees are welcome
At least 2 years programming experience in Java, Python, C++, or other mainstream language
Experience with machine learning modeling and classification algorithms.
Professional demeanor with strong interpersonal skills and self-starter attitude
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Robotics Software Engineering Intern
requirements:
CreateMe is a research and development company at the intersection of automation, apparel, and customization — driving on-demand manufacturing, at speed and scale. We’re breaking down barriers through trailblazing, frictionless technology that provides an end-to-end solution that is set to revolutionize individualism.

We’re based in New York City’s Soho neighborhood with a microfactory in Brooklyn and a manufacturing R&D lab in San Francisco's Dogpatch neighborhood.

About The Role

CreateMe is seeking a Robotics Engineering Intern such as yourself to be a part of a dynamic and innovative R&D team in the Bay Area. You would be a part of a team of Robotics, Electrical, Automation, and Mechanical Engineers developing automation technology in the apparel manufacturing space. We work in a fast paced and dynamic environment developing a suite of hardware and software applications. We are looking for a Robotics Software Engineering Intern who will work closely with our robotics team and develop prototypes. To be successful, you already have a good understanding of connected devices, robotics sensors, and programming.

Additional Responsibilities
Work in Research and Development (R&D) designing assemblies and sub-assemblies for our Automation products
Work with the R&D team to come up with innovative designs
Implement new designs from concept to manufacturing
Help build, test, and debug hardware applications
Quality assurance of the software and validation of CI/CD pipeline and software upgrades
Design, execute, and report experiments on robotic equipment and other hardware setups
Implement and validate software and hardware communication protocols
Maintain and update the documentation of various software modules
Collect data from sensors and label the data


Requirements
Proficiency in Python 3, C++, ROS, git, and docker
Inspired to work in the field of robotics and automation
Strong documentation skills
Strong communication skills, written and verbal


Preferred Requirements
Experience with Robotics sensors and MicroController Programming
You have working knowledge of IoT devices

At CreateMe Technologies, we value diversity and treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

requirements:
